title: How to Remove or Delete an Apple ID: Step-By-Step Guide

steps.title: Prepare your account for deletion.
steps.content: Prepare your account for deletion. When you delete your Apple ID, everything associated with your account is permanently deleted . There's no way to recover this information, so be sure you're using the correct account and you have all the necessary backups for your data. [1] X Research source Before you delete your Apple ID, make sure you: Backup photos, videos, and other documents on iCloud Backup iMessage , FaceTime, or iCloud Mail contacts added with your Apple ID Download copies of apps, games, music, movies, TV shows, books, and audiobooks Cancel active subscriptions made with your account Pay any remaining balances on Apple Pay Later Sign out of all devices that use your iCloud or Apple ID account If you don't do this, you might be locked out of your device when your Apple ID is deleted Save any other account information you may need in the future Deleting your account is permanent . If you're unsure or if you think you may use it again in the future, consider temporarily deactivating it instead. Follow the same preparations above before you deactivate.

steps.title: Go to https://privacy.apple.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://privacy.apple.com/ in a web browser. You can use a desktop or mobile account. Currently, there's no way to delete your account through an Apple device.

steps.title: Sign in with the Apple ID.
steps.content: Sign in with the Apple ID. Make sure this is the Apple ID you want to delete. You'll be redirected to the Manage your data page. This is also where you can obtain a copy of your data or transfer it to another service.

steps.title: Select Request to delete your account.
steps.content: Select Request to delete your account . You may need to scroll down to see this option. This is the small text underneath the Delete your account header. [2] X Research source If you want to disable your account temporarily, select Temporarily deactivate your account instead.

steps.title: Select a reason and select Continue.
steps.content: Select a reason and select Continue . You'll need to scroll down and read through Apple's warnings about deleting. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and select Continue.
steps.content: Scroll down and select Continue . This is the blue button.

steps.title: Check the box and select Continue.
steps.content: Check the box and select Continue . You'll need to agree to the Deletion Terms & Conditions. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Enter a method of communication.
steps.content: Enter a method of communication. This is how Apple will update you on the account's deletion process. This could be an email, phone number, or another Apple ID.

steps.title: Note down the access code and select Continue.
steps.content: Note down the access code and select Continue . You'll need this code again.

steps.title: Enter the access code and select Continue.
steps.content: Enter the access code and select Continue . You'll need to review the effects one last time.

steps.title: Select Delete account.
steps.content: Select Delete account . A final confirmation will appear.

steps.title: Select Sign out.
steps.content: Select Sign out . The request to delete your Apple ID will be sent.
